Comment: Creative and engaging way to practice string manipulation. :)

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Creative and intuitive challenge. I like the whole structure of the challenge, it‚Äôs overall very good; and fits well within the time constraints

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Visually cool puzzle that is quite simple once you know the trick.
Hey, cool puzzle! Quite easy to solve, it took me less than 5 minutes, simply with 2 loops. The instructions are clear. +1 upvot ;)

Is this solvable in 5 minutes or less for most languages?
Because for me, it took 6 mins

Goal
* Please change "a set of letters from" to "the letters of".

* Please change "square space" to "square grid" to be consistent with Constraints section and to avoid confusion with space as in "white space".

Input
* Please format "h" (in h x h) as a [[variable]] (twice).

* Please change "space" to "grid" for both descriptions.

Constraints
* Please do *not* format "height" and "width" as {{constants}}.

* Please add a space between "letter" and "(or".

* Please delete the second part of the last constraint, i.e. "If no letter is present in a column, print a space ' ' in its place." as it's an output requirement; it's not a constraint.

Stub generator
* Please change "1024" to "h".

Thanks.

Hey everyone,

Here‚Äôs my third contribution‚Äîit‚Äôs been a while since the last one. In the meantime, I got a little lost (or obsessed?) in the world of Advent of Code, solving puzzles and slowly losing my sanity.

If you happen to check it out and have any feedback, I‚Äôd really appreciate it.

As always, I was looking forward to your replies. Thanks for pointing out those issues. I was on the same page about the whole "space" wording too‚Äîmy brain was already half-fried from brainstorming the concept, so I didn‚Äôt fuss over the wording much, knowing you‚Äôd catch the things I missed.

All I can say is that it took me under 5 minutes to solve it in Python. That might be because I contributed the problem, so I already knew the trick ‚Äî treating the input as a 2D list (or matrix) and reading top to bottom, left to right column-wise.
My input probably won‚Äôt help much since I had that prior context, so I‚Äôd suggest waiting for others to chime in.
Please write your comments in English.
